$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 1. 4-(1-Imidazolylmethyl)-1-nitrobenzene: To a solution of imidazole
(0.5 g, 7.3 mmol) and 4-nitrobenzyl bromide (1.6 g, 7.3 mmol) in anh
acetonitrile (30 mL) was added K2CO3 (1.0 g, 7.3 mmol). The resulting
mixture was stirred at room temp. for 18 h and then poured into water
(200 mL) and the resulting aqueous solution was extracted with EtOAc
(3×50 mL). The combined organic layers were sequentially washed with
water (3×50 mL) and a saturated NaCl solution (2×50 mL), dried (MgSO4),
and concentrated in vacuo. The residual oil was purified by MPLC (silica
gel; 25% EtOAc/75% hexane) to afford the desired product. Yield: (1.0 g,
91%). El-MS m/z 203 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Heteroaryl ureas containing nitrogen hetero-atoms as p38 kinase
inhibitors
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 7646-69-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7647-01-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 872-50-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 3-Hydroxy-2-[4-(1H-imidazole-1-yl)-3-nitrophenyl]quinoline-4(1H)-one
Imidazole (0.48 mmol) was dissolved in N-methylpyrrolidone (1.0 ml).
Sodium hydride (0.48 mmol) was added to the solution, and after five
minutes also 2-(4-chlorine-3-nitrophenyl)-3-hydroxyquinoline-4(1H)-one
(0.4 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred for two hours at the boiling
point. It was then poured onto crushed ice and pH adjusted to pH 7 by
diluted HCl (1:3). The separated product was filtered off, washed twice
with water and dried up. It was recrystallized from 2-methoxyethanol.
Yield: 92 % by theory. melting point 278 to 280 °C, MS: m/z 349.0 [M+H]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of 2-phenyl-3-hydroxyquinolin-4(1H)-ones for treatment of
immune system and proliferative disorders

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM To a stirred solution of 1 (39 mg, 0.1 mmol) in methanol (10 mL), a
solution of imidazole (6.8 mg, 0.1 mmol) in methanol (2 mL) was added.
The solution was stirred under reflux for 3 h and the reaction progress
was monitored by HPLC. Subsequently, the solvent was removed under
reduced pressure and the residue was recrystallized from methanol/water
to give complex 2 as a yellowish solid. Yield: 92%. Slow evaporation of a
methanol/water solution afforded crystals suitable for X-ray analysis.
HPLC: tR = 14.9 min, IR (cm-1): 2009, 1867, 1579, and 1519; Anal. Calcd
(%) for C11H11N2O5Re: C, 30.20; H, 2.53; N, 6.40. Found: C, 30.29; H,
2.75; N, 6.63%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Curcumin as the OO Bidentate Ligand in "2 + 1" Complexes with the
[M(CO)3]+ (M = Re, 99mTc) Tricarbonyl Core for Radiodiagnostic
Applications

$DATUM 7778-53-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-64-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Compound 3a-h; General Procedure A mixture of
imidazole (0.34 g, 5 mmol) and anhyd K3PO4 (1.06 g, 5 mmol) in acetone
(20 mL) was stirred at r.t. for 5 min, and then carbon disulfide (1.14 g,
15 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred for additional 10
min, and then halide (5 mmol) was added. Stirring was continued at r.t.
until the reaction was completed (monitored by TLC). The precipitate was
filtered and washed with acetone. The solvent was evaporated under
reduced pressure and the residue was purified by recrystallization
(petroleum ether-EtOAc) to afford the desired compounds 3a or 3h or by
chromatography on silica gel column (petroleum ether-EtOAc) to give the
desired compounds 3b-g. Compound 3c Yield: 92%; yellow viscous oil. 1H
NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 4.06 (d, J = 6.9 Hz, 2 H, CH2), 5.30 (dd, J =
9.9, 0.9 Hz, 1 H, =CH2), 5.43 (ddd, J = 17.1, 2.4, 1.2 Hz, 1 H, =CH),
5.86-5.99 (m, 1 H, =CH2), 7.11 (d, J = 1.5 Hz, 1 H, ArH), 7.78 (d, J =
1.5 Hz, 1 H, ArH), 8.48 (s, 1 H, ArH). Anal. Calcd for C7H8N2S2: C,
45.62; H, 4.38; N, 15.20. Found: C, 45.88; H, 4.63; N, 15.30.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A mild and efficient procedure for the synthesis of
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Wang, Yi-Qiang; Ge, Ze-Mei; Hou, Xue-Ling; Cheng, Tie-Ming; Li, Run-Tao
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2004), (5), 675-678

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-64-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.2. Synthesis of the
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)-imidazoles. The
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)-imidazoles were synthesized according to a
literature method [12]. Typically, a mixture of imidazole (1 mM) and
dehydrated K3PO4 (1 mM) in acetone (5 mL) was stirred for 10 min in an
ice bath, and then carbon disulfide (3 mM) was added. The reaction
mixture was stirred for an additional 30 min and then halide (1 mM) was
added. Stirring was continued at room temperature until the reaction was
complete, which can be monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). The
precipitate was filtered and washed with acetone. The solvent was
evaporated under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by
chromatography on a silica gel column (petroleum ether/EtOAc = 5 : 1) to
give the desired product. Allyl 1H-imidazole-1-carbodithioate (2). Yellow
viscous oil; yield 91%. IR (cm-1): 1467 (C-N), 1053, 1005 (C-S), 833
(SCS), 1273, 1222 (imidazole); 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6): δ 4.14 (d, J =
6.8 Hz, 2H, ═CH2), 5.28 (dd, J = 1.2 Hz, 10.2 Hz, 1H, ═CH2), 5.31 (dd, J
= 1.4 Hz, 17.2 Hz, 1H, ═CH2), 5.91-5.99 (m, 1H, ═CH), 7.18 (d, J = 0.8
Hz, 1H, ArH), 8.02 (t, J = 1.6 Hz, 1H, ArH), and 8.64 (s, 1H, ArH).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM reactant assumed (stage 3)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis, characterization, and antitumor activities of new
palladium(II) complexes with 1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)-imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hou, Xueling; Li, Xiaobo; Hemit, Helimay; Aisa, Haji Akber
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Coordination Chemistry (2014), 67(3), 461-469

$DATUM A mixture solution of 3-bromo-9-phenyl-9H-carbazole (7.9 g, 24.52 mmol),
1H-imidazole (2.504 g, 36.8 mmol), CuI (1.401 g, 7.36 mmol) and K2CO3
(5.08 g, 36.8 mmol) in DMF (100 ml) was heated at 140° C. under nitrogen
overnight. After cooling to room temperature, the mixture solution was
filtered through a short plug of Celite®. The filtrate was poured into
water, extracted with DCM and dried over Na2SO4. Upon evaporation of the
solvent, the residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
with DCM/EtOAc (4/1, v/v) as eluent.
3-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-9-phenyl-9H-carbazole (7 g, 92%) as a white powder.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

ligands and application of the same in light-emitting devices

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for the Synthesis of Compound 3 A round-bottom flask
(10 mL) was charged with 2-(2- bromophenyl)imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine (1,
0.36 mmol), azole 2 (0.439 mmol), CuI (0.07 mmol), K2CO3 (0.732 mmol),
and DMF (2.0 mL). The resulting solution was stirred at 150 °C in an oil
bath for 2 h under nitrogen atmosphere. On completion, the reaction mass
was filtered through Celite and washed with EtOAc. The filtrate was
washed with H2O, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated
under vacuum. The crude residue was purified by column chromatography
(EtOAc-hexane, 2:3). The product 3.
2-[2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)phenyl]H-imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine (3a) Yield 92%;
colorless solid. mp 149-151 °C. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 8.42 (dd, J
= 7.9, 1.4 Hz, 1 H), 7.89 (dt, J = 6.8, 1.1 Hz, 1 H), 7.65-7.55 (m, 3 H),
7.44 (td, J = 7.6, 1.5 Hz, 1 H), 7.34 (dd, J = 7.8, 1.2 Hz, 1 H), 7.29
(s, 1 H), 7.18- 7.14 (m, 1 H), 7.06 (s, 1 H), 6.73 (td, J = 6.8, 1.1 Hz,
1 H), 6.29 (s, 1 H). 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 144.86, 140.10,
137.36, 134.31, 131.38, 129.95, 129.78, 129.67, 128.37, 127.71, 125.82,
125.06, 120.48, 117.43, 112.53, 109.70. HRMS: m/z calcd for C16H13N4 +:
261.1135; found: 261.1119 [M + H]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, Ullmann coupling reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

synthesis of azole-substituted imidazo[1,2-a]pyridines

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 123-91-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Experimental Procedures C for the
Cu(I)-catalyzed One-pot Synthesis of 2-Imidazylbenzimidazoles 6 Using
o-Haloarylcarbodiimides (Table 2). An oven-dried Schlenk tube was charged
with a magnetic stir bar, imidazole or 2-methylimidazole 5 (0.6 mmol, 1.2
equiv.), CuI (10 mg, 0.05 mmol, 10 mol%), 1,10-Phen·H2O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol,
20 mol%), and Cs2CO3 (326 mg, 1.0 mmol, 2.0 equiv.). The Schlenk tube was
capped with a Teflon screwcap, and then evacuated and backfilled with N2
(this sequence was carried out three times). Under a positive pressure of
N2, dioxane (1.5 mL) was added via syringe and the mixture was
pre-stirred at 60 °C in a preheated oil bath for 10 min. Then a solution
of o-haloarylcarbodiimide 1 (0.5 mmol, 1.0 equiv.) in dioxane (1.5 mL)
was added dropwise via syringe (for about 30 min). The tube was sealed
and the mixture was allowed to stir at the indicated temperature for
24-36 h. The reaction was stopped and cooled to room temperature. The
reaction mixture was directly passed through celite and rinsed with an
additional 30 mL of AcOEt. The combined filtrate was concentrated by
rotatory evaporation, and the residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (1:1
v/v) as eluent to give the corresponding product 6. The product could be
further purified by recrystallization from warm Et2O.
1-Benzyl-2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1H-benzo[d]imidazole (6j). m.p. 124- 126
°C; IR (neat) v 3090, 2918, 1614, 1544, 1453, 1424, 1243, 1062, 749, 728,
693, 661 cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.88 (s, 1H), 7.83 (d, J = 7.6
Hz, 1H), 7.26-7.40 (m, 7H), 7.21 (s, 1H), 7.05-7.07 (m, 2H), 5.34 (s, 2H)
ppm; 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 143.5, 140.6, 137.2, 134.9 (2 peaks),

$DATUM 7β -Acetoxy-8,13-epoxy-9α -hydroxy-6β
-[2-(1H-1,3-diazol-1-yl)acetyloxy]-1α
-(tert-butyldimethylsilyloxy)-labd-14-en-11-one (11) Compound 7 (0.578 g,
1 mmol) was dissolved in CH2Cl2 (10 ml), and imidazole (0.136 g, 2 mmol)
was added. The reaction mixture was stirred for 12 h at room temperature.
The reaction mixture was diluted with CH2Cl2. The organic layer was
washed with water, followed by brine. It was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was removed, and the residue was purified by flash
chromatography with 5% MeOH in CHCl3 (yield 0.6 g, 92.3%) (foam); 7β

$DATUM Synthesis of 2-(Imidazol-1-yl)-6-(3,5-dimenthylpyrazol-1-yl)- pyridine
(2a). A mixture of potassium (0.63 g, 16.0 mmol), imidazole (1.09 g, 16.0
mmol), and dry diglyme (50 mL) was vigorously stirred at 70 °C. Until
beads of the molten potassium were not evident,
2-bromo-6-(3,5-dimenthylpyrazol-1-yl)pyridine (4.00 g, 16.0 mmol) was
added. The reaction mixture was heated at 130 °C for 96 h and then
quenched by methanol (1.0 mL). After being cooled to ambient temperature,
the mixture was filtered through Celite, and all the volatiles were
removed under reduced pressure. Isolation by silica gel column
chromatography with ethyl acetate as the eluent afforded 2a as a white
solid (3.50 g, 92%).
2-(Imidazol-1-yl)-6-(3,5-dimenthylpyrazol-1-yl)pyridine (2a), yield 3.50
g, 92% M.p. 121-122 °C. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 23 °C, 400 MHz): δ 8.34 (s, 1H,
2"-H), 7.85 and 7.14 (m each, 2:1 H, pyridyl CH), 7.59 and 7.19 (s each,
1:1 H, 4"- and 5"-H), 6.01 (s, 1H, 4'-H), 2.70 and 2.28 (s each, 3:3 H,
3'- and 5'-CH3). 13C{1H} NMR (CDCl3, 23 °C, 400 MHz): δ 152.82 and 150.67
(s each, Cq each, C2 and C6), 146.95 and 141.74 (s each, Cq each, C3' and
C5'), 141.20, 135.10 and 130.75 (s each, 1:1:1 CH, pyridyl CH), 116.23,
112.79 and 110.05 (s each, 1:1:1 CH, imidazolyl CH), 107.81 (s, C4'),
15.41 (s, C3'-CH3), 13.74 (s, C5'-CH3). Anal. Calcd for C13H13N5: C,
65.25; H, 5.48; N, 29.27. Found: C, 65.24; H, 5.34; N, 28.93.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: tert-Butyl
2-[2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidin-4-yl]ethyl-3-fluorophenethyl Carbamate
(55). Compound 48 (0.335 g, 0.791 mmol) was dissolved in MeCN (5 mL), and
imidazole (0.269 g, 3.958 mmol) and K2CO3 (0.22 g, 1.583 mmol) were added
to the solution. The resulting mixture was heated at 65 °C for 5 h, after
which it was cooled and diluted with CH2Cl2 (20 mL). Water (20 mL) was
added to the organic layer and the layers separated. The aqueous layer
was washed once with CH2Cl2 (15 mL), and the combined organics were dried
over anhydrous sodium sulfate, concentrated, and purified by flash column
chromatography using hexanes/EtOAc. tert-Butyl
2-[2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidin-4-yl]ethyl-3-(3-chlorophenyl)propylcarbamate
(57). Colorless viscous oil (0.541 g, 91%). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ
8.63 (s, 1 H), 8.54 (d, J = 4.9 Hz, 1 H), 7.88 (s, 1 H), 7.18 (q, J = 7.5
Hz, 1 H), 7.17-7.14 (m, 3 H), (7.09 (s), 7.05 (s), 3:2, 1 H), 7.03 (d, J
= 7.1 Hz, 1 H), 3.65-3.55 (m, 2 H), 3.25-3.14 (m, 2 H), 3.05-2.94 (m, 2
H), 2.57 (t, J = 7.7 Hz, 2 H), 1.83 (p, J = 7.6 Hz, 2 H), 1.39 (s, 9 H).
13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3): δ 170.49, 158.39, (155.38, 155.21, 1 C),
154.40, 143.39, 136.01, 134.14, (130.34, 130.21, 1 C), 129.65, 128.34,
126.40, 126.15, 118.55, 116.54, 79.80, (47.27, 47.06, 1 C), (46.28,
46.12, 1 C), (36.99, 36.21, 1 C), 32.77, (29.91, 29.73, 1 C), 28.32. MS
(ESI) m/z [M + H]+: calcd, 442.19; found, 442.06.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: tert-Butyl
2-[2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidin-4-yl]ethyl-3-fluorophenethyl Carbamate
(55). Compound 48 (0.335 g, 0.791 mmol) was dissolved in MeCN (5 mL), and
imidazole (0.269 g, 3.958 mmol) and K2CO3 (0.22 g, 1.583 mmol) were added
to the solution. The resulting mixture was heated at 65 °C for 5 h, after
which it was cooled and diluted with CH2Cl2 (20 mL). Water (20 mL) was
added to the organic layer and the layers separated. The aqueous layer
was washed once with CH2Cl2 (15 mL), and the combined organics were dried
over anhydrous sodium sulfate, concentrated, and purified by flash column
chromatography using hexanes/EtOAc. tert-Butyl
2-[2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidin-4-yl]ethyl[2-(3-fluorobenzyl)cyclopropyl]carbamate
(59). Off-white sticky oil (0.372 g, 91%). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ
8.62 (s, 1 H), 8.52 (d, J = 5.0 Hz, 1 H), 7.88 (s, 1 H), 7.25-7.18 (m, 1
H), 7.16 (s, 1 H), 6.99 (s, 1 H), 6.96 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1 H), 6.91 (d, J =
9.8 Hz, 1 H), 6.87 (td, J = 8.5, 2.3 Hz, 1 H), (3.53 (t, J = 7 Hz), 3.50
(t, J = 7 Hz), 2:1, 2 H), 2.88 (t, J = 6.5 Hz, 2 H), 2.84 (dd, J = 10, 5
Hz, 1 H), 2.43 (dd, J = 14.0, 8.0 Hz, 1 H), 2.36 (dt, J = 7.2, 3.6 Hz, 1
H), 1.37 (s, 9 H), 1.23-1.20 (m, 1 H), 0.86 (dt, J = 9.3, 5.3 Hz, 1 H),
0.72 (q, J = 6.1 Hz, 1 H). 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3): δ 170.62, (163.80,
161.85, d, J = 245.7 Hz, 1 C), 158.30, 156.21, 154.36, (143.16, 143.11,
d, J = 6.3 Hz, 1 C), 136.06, 130.30, (129.86, 129.80, d, J = 7.56 Hz, 1
C), (124.08, 124.06, d, J = 2.52 Hz, 1 C), 118.39, 116.53, (115.29,
115.13, d, J = 20.16 Hz, 1 C), (113.09, 112.93, d, J = 20.16 Hz, 1 C),
79.83, 46.13, 37.67, 35.99, 34.88, 28.31, 23.02, 15.01. MS (ESI) m/z [2 M
+ Na]+: calcd, 897.43; found, 897.32.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-Cinnamoylimidazole: General procedure for the preparation of
acyl-imidazoles and -pyrazoles: In a typical experiment imidazole (20
mmol) was dissolved in distilled CH2Cl2 (20 mL) containing TEA (20 mmol)
and cooled to 0 degC under a steady flow of argon. The requisite acid
chloride (20 mmol) dissolved in 10 mL of CH2Cl2 (distilled) was delivered
dropwise over several minutes to the stirring solution imidazole solution
at 0 degC. The mixture was allowed to warm to 25 degC and stirred at this
temperature for 2 hr to ensure completion. The reaction mixture was then
diluted with 100 mL of diethyl ether, filtered and evaporated under
reduced pressure. Purification through silica gel with hexanes:ethyl
acetate (3:1) furnished 100 % yields. According to the general procedure,
the product was obtained.3.6 g (92 %); white powder; mp 129-130 degC.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

and a demonstration of the synthetic utility of the reaction

$DATUM Bryan, Vernal Jermaine
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM (2000), 62(12), 157 pages

$DATUM Synthesis of 2',3'-diacetyl ImGMP (6). To a stirred solution of
2',3'-diacetyl GMP TEA salt 5 (1.30 g, 2.38 mmol) in 20-mL dry DMF,
imidazole (0.81 g, 11.91 mmol), triphenyl phosphine (1.25 g, 4.77 mmol),
aldrithiol (1.05 g, 4.77 mmol) and TEA (0.24 g, 2.38 mmol) were added.
The reaction mixture was stirred under argon atmosphere at rt for 15 h.
To a solution of sodium perchlorate (1.50 g) in 100-mL acetone in a
centrifuge tube at 0°C, the above reaction mixture was added slowly for 5
minutes. The resulting mixture was centrifuged and the supernatant liquid
was removed. The solid was ground with a new portion of acetone (100 mL),
cooled, and centrifuged again. This process was repeated over twomore
times, and the resulting solid was dried in a vacuum desiccator over
P2O5. A white powder 6 (Yield: 1.12 g, 92%).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of
N,N-Dimethyl-4-((4-(methylthio)-5-tosyl-1 H-pyrrol-3-yl)
(phenyl)methyl)aniline 3a CuBr2 (4 mg, 10 mol%) and N,N-dimethylaniline
4a (19 mg 0.16 mmol) were added in sequence to a stirred solution of
(4-(methylthio)-5-tosyl-1H-pyrrol-3-yl)(phenyl)methanol 2 (60 mg,
0.16mmol) in 2mL DCE at room temperature. The reaction mixture was
allowed to reflux for 2h, by which time the reaction was complete
(measured by thin-layer chromatography, TLC). The reaction mixture was
the diluted with dichloromethane (DCM, 20 mL), and the resulting solution
was washed with water (2× 20 mL) and brine solution (20 mL). The organic
layer was separated and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. Evaporation of DCM
solvent under reduced pressure resulted in crude product, which was
subjected to column chromatography using silica gel (100-200 mesh) and
solution of EtOAc in hexanes (8:2).
5-((4-(Methylthio)-5-tosyl-1H-pyrrol-3-yl)(phenyl)methyl)-1H-imidazole
3f: Yield: 92%. Mp 212 °C; RF = 0.4 (hexanes:EtOAc 8:2); IR (KBr): 3445,
3120, 2924, 2860, 1731, 1595, 1495, 1451, 1325, 1233, 1185, 1148, 1108,
1082, 734, 698, 669, 597 cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 11.2 (s, 1H),
7.92 (d, J = 8.3 Hz, 2H), 7.58 (s, 1H), 7.33-7.29 (m, 4H), 7.28 (s, 1H),
7.10 (s, 1H), 7.05-7.02 (m, 2H), 6.86 (s, 1H), 6.63 (s, 1H), 6.59 (s,
1H), 2.39 (s, 3H), 1.76 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 144.6 (C),
139.1 (C), 138.3 (C), 137.5 (C), 132.4 (C), 129.8 (CH), 129.2 (C), 128.9
(CH), 128.8 (CH), 128.4 (CH), 127.8 (CH), 127.0 (CH), 121.8 (CH), 119.3
(CH), 118.7 (C), 57.4 (CH), 21.7 (CH3), 20.3 (CH3); HRMS (ESI+) calcd for
C22H21N3O2S2Na (M + Na) 446.0973 found 446.0973.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for the synthesis of 2, 3 To a solution of imidazole
(30 mmol, 2.04 g) or benzimidazole (30 mmol, 3.66 g) in 30 mL dry DMF
under nitrogen, 31 mmol NaH (0.74 g) was added. After stirred at room
temperature for 30 minutes, compound 1 (10 mmol, 3.99 g) in 30 mL DMF was
added dropwise over 3 hours. The mixture was stirred for 20 hours, the
solvent was removed in vacuo and the residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (50% CH2Cl2-EtOAc) to give 2 or 3. 1, 3,
5-Tris(N-imidazolylmethyl)-2, 4, 6-trimethylbenzene 2 was obtained as
colorless powder in 92% yield. m.p. 226-227°C. 1H-NMR(200MHz, D2O):
2.39(s, 9H, CH)), 5.55(s, 6H, CH2), 7.17(s, 6H, imidazolium ring 4, 5-H),
7.74(s, 3H, imidazolium ring 2-H). MS(m/z, RA%): 360(M+, 12), 292(21),
225(100), 210(74), 69(71). Anal. calcd. for C21H24N6: C, 69.97; H, 6.71;
N, 23.32. Found: C, 69.59; H, 6.79; N, 23.39.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A convenient and effective synthesis of tris-bridged tricationic
azolophanes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Yuan, Yi; Jiang, Zong-Lin; Yan, Jia-Ming; Gao, Ge; Chan, Albert S. C.;
Xie, Ru-Gang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2000), 30(24), 4555-4561

$DATUM Method B. Sulfuryl chloride (0.15 ml, 1.85 mmol) was added dropwise to a
solution of fluorosugar 11 (0.17 g, 0.63 mmol) in anhydrous CH2Cl2 (2 mL)
and DMF (0.53 ml) at -40°C. The reaction mixture was stirred at this tem
perature during 50 minutes and then for 90 minutes at room tem perature.
After cooling to 0°C, 0.55 g (8.08 mmol) imidazole was added to prepared
solution and the reaction m ixture was stirred at room tem perature for
18 hours. After standard work-up and removal of solvent, the residue was
chrom atographed on a silica gel (25 mL), using for elution mixture
EtOAc/hexane 1:3, 1:2, and 2:1. Methyl
5-O-benzoyl-3-deoxy-3-fluoro-2-O-(imidazolylsulfonyl)-α-D-ribofuranoside
(7). Yield: (0.232 g, 92%), Syrup. Rf 0.79 (B). 1H NMR (CDCl3): 7.10-7.98
(m, 8 H, Ar-H), 4.97 (ddd, 1H, J3,2 = 5.7J 3,4 = 1.8, J3,F = 56.4, H-3),
4.91 (d, 1H, H-1, J1,2 = 4.6), 4.78 (dt, 1HJ2,F = 20.0, H-2), 4.62 (dm,
1H, H-4, J4,F = 24.8), 4.57 (dd, 1H, H-5, J5,4 = 3.4, J5,5' = 12.2), 4.43
(dd, 1H, H-5', J5,4 = 3.2), 3.38 (s, 3H, OCH3). 13C (CDCl3): 165.8 (s,
C═O, Bz), 137.1, 133.9, 131.5, 129.6, 129.2, 128.9 and 118.3 (s, C6H5CO-
and C3H3N2SO2-), 100.2 (s, C-1), 87.8 (d, JC-3,F = 196.7, C-3), 80.1 (d,
JC-2,F = 24.9, C-2), 78.0 (d, JC-4,F = 14.9, C-4), 63.1 (d, JC-5,F = 8.3,
C-5), 56.0 (s, OCH3). 19F (CDCl3): -193.55 (dt, F-3). Anal. calc, for
C16H17FN2O7S: C, 48.00; H, 4.28; N, 6.99; Found : C, 48.09; H, 4.32; N,
7.15.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: MP-Pyr(NO2)NH2:
2-Amino-6-(4-methylpiperazinyl)-3-nitropyridine (5) was General Procedure
B: The nucleophilic aromatic substitution reaction of
2-amino-6-chloro-3-nitropyridine with amines. Typically, a mixture of 10
mmol of 2-amino-6-chloro-3-nitropyridine, 30 mmol (3 mol equiv) of
anhydrous K2CO3, and 20 mmol (2 mol equiv) of the requisite amine
reactant in 50 mL of dimethylformamide (DMF) was stirred at 40-50 °C for
5-8 h. The reaction mixture was poured into iced water, and extracted
with EtOAc or CHCl3. The organic extracts, after drying (over anhydrous
Na2SO4) and evaporation afford the respective
6-substituted-3-nitropyridin-2-amine derivatives which were usually
purified by silica gel flash chromatography. Im-Pyr(NO2)NH2:
2-Amino-6-(imidazol-1-yl)-3-nitropyridine (9) was prepared in 92%
isolated yield from imidazole and compound 3 according to general
procedure B described above. 1H-NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.48 (s, 1H,
Im-CH), 8.41 (d, 1H, J = 9.5 Hz, Pri-CH), 7.68 (s, 1H, Im-CH), 7.29 (d,
1H, J = 9.5 Hz, Pri-CH), 7.12 (s, 1H, Im-CH), 6.99 (s, exch, 2H, NH2).
FAB-HRMS: m/z calcd for C8H8N5O2+ (MH+) 206.0678, found 206.0682 (100%).

$DATUM rac-N-[2,3-Di(octadecyloxy)prop-1-yloxymethyl]imidazole (5a). Imidazole
(0.015 g, 0.22 mmol) and Br2 (6.2 μL, 0.12 mmol) were added successively
to a solution of methylthiomethyl ether 1d (0.66 g, 0.1 mmol) in 3 mL of
anhydrous ClCH2CH2Cl, and the mixture was stirred for 10 min. The residue
obtained after removal of the solvent was chromatographed using CHCl3 as
the eluent. 0.063 g (92%) of compound 5a. R f 0.71 (B), m.p. 70-71 °C.
MS, m/z (I rel (%)): 678.0 [M]+ (25), 699.8 [M + Na]+ (100). Calculated
for C43H84N2O3: 676.65 [M]+, 699.64 [M + Na]+. 1H NMR, δ: 0.87 (t, 6 H, 2
(CH2)17CH3, J = 6.8 Hz); 1.23 (br.s, 60 H, 2 (CH2)15CH3); 1.43-1.61 (m, 4
H, 2 OCH2CH2); 3.35-3.56 (m, 9 H, 2 OCH2CH2, CH2OC18H37, CHOC18H37,
CH2O); 5.31 and 5.37 (both d, each 1 H, OCH2N, J = 11.9 Hz); 7.04-7.07
(m, 1 H) and 7.09-7.13 (m, 1 H, CH=CH); 7.73-7.77 (m, 1 H, CH=N).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 5.
6-[2-(1H-Imidazo1-yl)-1,1-dimethylethoxy]-5-(2-phenylethyl)-3,4-dihydro-1(2H)-naphthalenone
A mixture of sodium hydride (60% dispersion in oil, 32 mg, 0.81 mmol), 20
acetonitrile (0.4 mL), and imidazole (275 mg, 4.0 mmol) was stirred at
room temperature for 10 min, whereupon a solution of
2-methy2-{[5-oxo-1-(2-
phenylethyl)-5,6,7,8-tetrahydro-2-naphthalenyl]oxy}propyl
trifluoromethanesulfonate (190 mg, 0.40 mmol) in acetonitrile (0.8 mL)
was added. The resulting mixture was stirred at reflux for 20 min and was
then concentrated. The residue was purified by dry-flash column
chromatography (SiO2, 1-10% 2-propanoldichloromethane) to give
6-[2-(1H-imidazo1-yl)-1,1-dimethylethoxy]-5-(2-phenylethyl)-3,4-dihydro-1(2H)-naphthalenone.
NMR spectrum was consistent with structure. Colorless oil, yield 126 mg,
92%. MS El: M+* 388.2149 (M+* 388.2151).

$DATUM Preparation of 5-substituted tetralones as inhibitors of ras farnesyl
transferase for treatment of proliferative diseases

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for the Preparation of
3-FIuoro-1-nitro-4-(azolyl)benzenes 13c-f, 37, 61, 62, and 81. The azole
(1 equiv.), K2CO3 or dibasic potassium phosphate (2 equiv.) and
3,4-difluoronitrobenzene (1 equiv.) were heated to 90 °C in DMSO for 18h.
The reaction was cooled diluted with water (100 mL) and extracted with
ethyl acetate (2 x 100 mL). The organic layers were washed with water (5
x 100 mL) and with brine (75 mL). Drying (Na2SO4) and concentration in
vacuo afforded crude products. 3-Fluoro-4-(1H-imidazo1-yl)nitrobenzene
(13c). Work-up afford a brown solid that was chromatographed over 250 g
silica gel eluting with 0-2% MeOH/CH2Cl2 gradient to yield 6.0 g (92%) of
a bronze colored solid. mp 103-104°C (dec.); 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ
8.17 (d, J= 10.7 Hz, 1 H), 8.17 (d, J = 10.6 Hz, 1 H), 7.96 (bs, 1 H),
7.62 (t, J = 8.2 Hz, 1 H), 7.34 (bs, 1 H), 7.26 (bs, 1 H); MS (El) m/z
207 (M+H); HRMS (El) calcd for C9H6FN3O2 207.0444, found 207.0459.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, other reagent may also be used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Substituent effects on the antibacterial activity of
nitrogen-carbon-linked (azolylphenyl)oxazolidinones with expanded
activity against the fastidious Gram-negative organisms Haemophilus
influenzae and Moraxella catarrhalis
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Genin, Michael J.; Allwine, Debra A.; Anderson, David J.; Barbachyn,
Michael R.; Emmert, D. Edward; Garmon, Stuart A.; Graber, David R.;
Grega, Kevin C.; Hester, Jackson B.; Hutchinson, Douglas K.; Morris,
Joel; Reischer, Robert J.; Ford, Charles W.; Zurenko, Gary E.; Hamel,
Judith C.; Schaadt, Ronda D.; Stapert, Douglas; Yagi, Betty H.

$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for N-Arylation of Imidazole
with Aryl Bromides. A Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon stopcock are
charged with a magnetic stir bar, K2CO3 (572 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuI (0.38 mg,
0.20 mmol, 20 mol %), and per-6-amino- β -cyclodextrin (100 mg, 0.08
mmol, 8 mol %). DMSO (1 mL) was added at room temperature. Then a
solution of bromobenzene (188 mg, 1.2 mmol) and imidazole (68 mg, 1.0
mmol) in DMSO (1 mL) was added. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 110°C. Water (5 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture after completion of the reaction. Then it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated by vacuum. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel, using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:3) as
eluant, to give an oil of 1-phenylimidazole 4a (164 mg, 98%)
1-(4-(Trifluoromethoxy)phenyl)-1H-imidazole (4j), yield 92% 1H NMR (400
MHz): 7.86 (bs, 1H), 7.39 (d, 2H), 7.24 (d, 2H), 6.73-6.36 (m, 2H) 13C
NMR (100 MHz): 149.9, 134.7, 132.0, 130.4, 128.5, 123.0, 121.2, 118.1,
115.5, 112.9 GC-MS: m/z 209.9 (M+)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed tube used, Ullmann reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Per-6-amino-β-cyclodextrin as an Efficient Supramolecular Ligand and Host
for Cu(I)-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazole with Aryl Bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Suresh, Palaniswamy; Pitchumani, Kasi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(22), 9121-9124

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure D: To a solution of a cyclic
amide (typically 0.5 mmol), Ph2O2 (73 mg, 0.5 mmol) and BOP (287 mg, 0.65
mmol) was added DBU (112 μL, 0.75 mmol) at room temperature. The
resultant mixture was stirred for 5 . 10 min, after which the
nucleophile, i.e. t-Bu-NH2 (150 μL, 1.50 mmol) was added drop-wise. The
reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature overnight, then heated
to 60 °C and monitored by LCMS until complete disappearance of starting
material was observed. The solvent was removed under vacuum, and the
crude reaction mixture was purified either by flash chromatography on
SiO2 column eluted with hexanes/EtOAc or MeOH/EtOAc solvent system or by
HPLC with MeCN/H2O to give the desired product in high purity. A
reference standard sample of a 1:1 mixture of pure product and PH2O was
made, and an LCMS calibration was performed to allow calculation of the
LCMS yield.3 4-Imidazol-1-yl-quinazoline (42). Synthesized according to
general procedure D (rt, overnight, then 80 °C, 4 h) from
4-hydroxyquinazoline 5 (73 mg, 0.5 mmol), BOP (287 mg, 0.65 mmol), DBU
(112 μL, 0.75 mmol) and imidazole (156 mg, 2.25 mmol), purified by flash
chromatography as a white solid (90 mg, 92%). Mp 98 °C. 1H NMR (DMSO-d6,
400 MHz): δ 9.26 (s, 1H), 8.51 (s, 1H), 8.23.8.14 (m, 3H), 7.97 (s, 1H),
7.89.7.85 (m, 1H), 7.30 (s, 1H). 13C NMR (DMSO-d6, 100 MHz): 155.2,
154.1, 152.2, 138.1, 135.2, 130.1, 129.4, 128.5, 124.8, 120.5, 117.5.
HRMS (ESI) m/z calcd for C11H8N4 (M + H+) 197.0821, found 197.0818.

$DATUM 4-(1H-Imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzaldehyde (3) To a well-stirred mixture of 2
(2.99 g, 0.015 mol) and potassium carbonate (4.15 g, 0.03 mol) in
chloroform (25 ml) was added imidazole (2.18 g, 0.032 mol) and stirred
for 2 h at room temperature. The solid was colletedand chloroform was
removed by distillation (and recycled). The resulting crude product was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, ethyl acetate). 3 (2.57 g, 92%)
as a colorless oil. bp. 149-15 l°C/0.2 mm, lit.7 bp. 150°C/0.2 mm. 1H-NMR
(CDCl3): δ 5.247 (s, 2H), 6.956 (s, 1H), 7.098 (d, 1H), 7.296 (d, 2H),
7.60 (s, 1H), 7.850 (d, 2H), 9.980 (s, 1H). IR: 1695 cm-1, 1638 cm-1,
1515 cm-1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM a) 1-(5-Imidazol-1-yl-2-nitro-phenyl)-piperidine To
1-(5-chloro-2-nitro-phenyl)-piperidine (184 mg, 0.760 mmol, as prepared
in Example 3, step (a)) and imidazole (67.8 mg, 0.99 mmol) in 3 mL of
DMSO was added KOH (64 mg, 1.11 mmol). The reaction was heated to 90° C.
overnight. The dark solution was poured into 40 mL of water and extracted
with EtOAc (2×50 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with water
(50 mL), dried (Na2SO4) and concentrated in vacuo to give 190 mg (92%) of
the title compound as a yellow solid. Mass spectrum (ESI, m/z): Calcd.
for C14H16N4O2, 273.1 (M+H), found 273.1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: N-Arylation of Azoles with Arylboronic Acid at
Ambient Conditions; General Procedure. Cu2O (0.055 mmol) was added to a
mixture of azole (1.2 mmol) and arylboronic acid (1 mmol) in MeOH (3 mL)
at r.t., and the mixture was stirred for 5 h under an atmosphere of air.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC and on completion of
the reaction, the mixture was centrifuged and the centrifugate was
concentrated under reduced pressure to give the crude product. The crude
product was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(hexane-EtOAc, 70:30) to afford the N-arylated azoles.
1-(4-Bromophenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 1, entry 6), yield 92%. 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.83 (br s, 1 H), 7.63 (m, 2 H), 7.32-7.20 (m, 4 H). 13C
NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 136.3, 135.4, 132.9, 130.7, 122.9, 120.8, 118.0.
EI-MS: m/z = 222 (M+). Anal. Calcd for C9H7BrN2: C, 48.46; H, 3.16; N,
12.56. Found: C, 48.41; H, 3.11; N, 12.53.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst reusable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper(I) oxide-catalyzed N-arylation of azoles and amines with
arylboronic acid at room temperature under base-free conditions

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis [ Ni(Im)6](DBSH)2·2DMF(I)(H2DBSH-3,5-dibromosalicylaldehyde).
Ni(Ac)2·2H2O (0.110 g, 0.5 mmol) was added to a solution of H2DBSH (0.122
mg, 0.5 mmol) in methanol (20 ml) and DMF (20 ml). After stirring the
mixture for 2 h at 80°C , the resulting brown solution was cooled to room
temperature. The mixture was filtered and the filtrate was allowed to
stand for 1 week, during which brown crystals were formed. The yield was
92.1%. For C38H44Br4N14Ni anal . calcd , %: C , 38.96; H , 3.79; N ,
16.74. Found , %: C , 39.01; H , 3.91; N , 16.79. IR ( KBr ; ν , cm-1):
2750 m (C-H in -CHO), 1721 m (C=O), 1430 br (C-N), 1261 br (Ar-O), 1066 m
(Im), 700 m (C-Br), 630 m (Im), 520 m (Ni-N).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis, crystal structure, and electrochemical properties of the
complex [Ni(imidazole)6](DBSH)2·2DMF
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ding, Y.; Gao, D. S.; Li, S. D.; Li, X. H.; Li, C. L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Russian Journal of Coordination Chemistry (2009), 35(9), 663-667

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for the Reaction of 6-Bromopurine Derivatives with
Aromatic Amines. The aromatic amine (6 equiv) was added to a solution of
the 6-bromopurine derivative (0.109-0.116 mmol) in the appropriate
solvent (5 mL). The reaction mixture was heated at 65 °C for 5 h or until
completion by TLC (see Table 1). The mixture was concentrated under
reduced pressure, the resulting residue dissolved in EtOAc, and the
solution was successively washed with 10% aqueous citric acid (1 x 25 mL)
and brine (1 x 25 mL). The organic layer was dried (Na2SO4), filtered,
and concentrated under reduced pressure. The crude products were purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel using appropriate solvent
systems (listed under individual compound headings, vide infra). A
different workup procedure was employed when DMF was used as the solvent.
The reaction mixture was diluted with EtOAc/hexanes (7:3, 25 mL) and
washed successively with water (1 x 15 mL) and brine (1 x 15 mL). The
organic layer was dried (Na2SO4), filtered, and concentrated under
reduced pressure. The crude products were purified by flash column
chromatography on silica gel using appropriate solvent systems (listed
under individual compound headings, vide infra).
2',3',5'-Tri-O-acetyl-6-(imidazol-1-yl)nebularine (8a). Chromatography,
2% MeOH/CHCl3. Yellow foam (92%). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 300 MHz): δ (ppm) 9.41
(br s, 1H), 8.78 (s, 1H), 8.36 (br s, 1H), 8.27 (s, 1H), 7.24 (br s, 1H),
6.26 (d, J = 5.1 Hz, 1H), 5.97 (t, J = 5.4 Hz, 1H), 5.66 (t, J = 5.1 Hz,
1H), 4.51-4.46 (m, 1H), 4.39 (dd, J = 12.3, 4.8 Hz, 2H), 2.15 (s, 3H),
2.13 (s, 3H), 2.08 (s, 3H). 13C NMR (CDCl3, 75 MHz): δ (ppm) 170.2,
169.5, 169.3, 153.0, 152.5, 145.9, 142.7, 137.6, 130.7, 122.9, 117.3,
86.6, 80.4, 73.1, 70.5, 62.9, 20.7, 20.5, 20.3. HRCIMS: calcd for
C19H21N6O7 (M + H)+ 445.1468, obsd 445.1462.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Experimental Procedures C for the
Cu(I)-catalyzed One-pot Synthesis of 2-Imidazylbenzimidazoles 6 Using
o-Haloarylcarbodiimides (Table 2). An oven-dried Schlenk tube was charged
with a magnetic stir bar, imidazole or 2-methylimidazole 5 (0.6 mmol, 1.2
equiv.), CuI (10 mg, 0.05 mmol, 10 mol%), 1,10-Phen·H2O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol,
20 mol%), and Cs2CO3 (326 mg, 1.0 mmol, 2.0 equiv.). The Schlenk tube was
capped with a Teflon screwcap, and then evacuated and backfilled with N2
(this sequence was carried out three times). Under a positive pressure of
N2, dioxane (1.5 mL) was added via syringe and the mixture was
pre-stirred at 60 °C in a preheated oil bath for 10 min. Then a solution
of o-haloarylcarbodiimide 1 (0.5 mmol, 1.0 equiv.) in dioxane (1.5 mL)
was added dropwise via syringe (for about 30 min). The tube was sealed
and the mixture was allowed to stir at the indicated temperature for
24-36 h. The reaction was stopped and cooled to room temperature. The
reaction mixture was directly passed through celite and rinsed with an
additional 30 mL of AcOEt. The combined filtrate was concentrated by
rotatory evaporation, and the residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (1:1
v/v) as eluent to give the corresponding product 6. The product could be
further purified by recrystallization from warm Et2O.
2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)-1-p-tolyl-1H-benzo[d]imidazole (6c)., yield 92% m.p.
130- 132 °C; IR (neat) 3053, 2922, 1612, 1539, 1514, 1438, 1322, 1068,
1013, 828, 738, 721 cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.79 (d, J = 8.0 Hz,
1H), 7.75 (s, 1H), 7.33-7.36 (m, 3H), 7.24-7.29 (m, 1H), 7.15-7.19 (m,
4H), 7.04 (s, 1H), 2.45 (s, 3H) ppm; 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 142.9,
140.4, 140.2, 136.8, 136.0, 131.7, 131.1, 130.0, 126.7, 123.8, 123.6,
119.7, 118.7, 110.5, 21.3 ppm; Anal. Calcd. for C17H14N4: C 74.43, H
5.14, N 20.42, found: C 74.44, H 5.15, N 20.40; EI-MS: m/z = 274 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM anhydrous condition required, sealed tube used

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Lv, Xin; Bao, Weiliang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(15), 5618-5621

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.2 Synthesis of 4 General procedure for the
preparation of 4: A mixture of thioether 3 and imidazole or benzimidazole
(8 equiv.) in degassed glacial AcOH was stirred at 80 °C for 6 h. The
reaction mixture was quenched with an excess saturated NaHCO3 solution
and extracted with CH2Cl2 (15 mL × 3). The combined organic extracts were
washed with brine and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and
evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by
flash column chromatography to afford the corresponding (S, Rp)-4.
1-{(S)-1-[(R)-2-(tert-Butylthio)ferrocenyl]ethyl}-imidazole (4g). 3g (1
g, 2.90 mmol) and imidazole (1.58 g, 23.2 mmol) in glacial AcOH (11 mL)
were used with reference to the general procedure. Yield: 92%, yellow
solid. Rf = 0.3 (EtOAc/hexane/Et3N = 1/1/0.01). [α]D20 +231.9° (c 1.0,
CH2Cl2); m.p.= 110-113 °C; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.43 (s, 1H), 6.89
(s, 1H), 6.79 (s, 1H), 5.47 (q, 1H, J = 7.0 Hz), 4.55 (s, 1H), 4.50 (s,
1H), 4.39 (s, 1H), 4.17 (s, 5H), 1.81 (d, 3H, J = 6.5 Hz), 0.85 (s 9H);
13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 135.7, 128.8, 117.1, 89.4, 77.3, 77.2, 70.6,
68.8, 67.6, 50.5, 46.2, 30.3, 23.8; IR (cm-1) 3076, 2957, 2932, 2771,
1652, 1493, 1453, 1406, 1362, 1248, 1218, 1170, 1107, 1071, 1000, 814,
730, 661; MS(EI): 368.10 [M]+; HRMS(EI): calcd for C19H24FeN2S [M]+:
368.1010; found 368.1005.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Arylazoles 3 and 4; General Procedure A sealed
tube equipped with a Teflon valve was charged with a magnetic stir bar,
CuBr (7 mg, 0.05 mmol, 5 mol%), Cs2CO3 (650 mg, 2 mmol) and any remaining
solids (azoles 2 and/or aryl halides 1). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with N2 (3×). Under a counter flow of N2, azole 2 (1.2 mmol,
if liquid), aryl halide 1 (1 mmol, if liquid), DMSO (1.0 mL), and L1 (18
mg, 0.10 mmol, 10 mol%) were added by syringe. The tube was evacuated and
again backfilled with N2 (3×) and sealed. The mixture was heated to the
indicated temperature for the required time period. After cooling to
r.t., the mixture was diluted with EtOAc (25 mL), passed through a
fritted glass filter to remove the inorganic salts and the filtrate was
washed by H2O, brine, then removed under vacuum. The residue was purified
by column chromatography (silica gel) and the product was dried under
high vacuum (at least 1 h). 1-Naphthalen-1-yl-1H-imidazole (3q)5e 1H NMR
(300 MHz, DMSO-d 6): δ = 8.15 (d, 2 H), 8.00 (s, 1 H), 7.66 (m, 1 H),
7.60 (m, 2 H), 7.56 (m, 2 H), 7.50 (m, 1 H), 7.20 (s, 1 H). MS: m/z =
194.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 2-(N-Imidazolyl)-7-hydroxy-6-methoxy-3-(3,4,5-trimethoxybenzoyl)benzo[b]furan
(15l): A mixture of
7-acetoxy-2-bromo-6-methoxy-3-(3,4,5-trimethoxybenzoyl)benzo[b]furan
(12b, 300 mg, 0.63 mmol) and imidazole (14l, 200 mg, 2.94 mmol) in a dry
pyridine (5 mL) was stirred at reflux for 3 hours. The solvent was
distilled under vacuum and the crude residue was purified by silica gel
column (eluent = dichloromethane:methanol; 95:5) to give a yellow solid
which was contaminated with imidazole was dissolved in dichloromethane
and washed with water (20 mL). The organic layer was separated and dried
over magnesium sulfate and solvent was distilled to give pure title
compound as yellow powder (243 mg, 92 %, mp = 122-24 ÂºC). 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3) Î´ 8.24 (bs, 1H), 7.52 (b, 1H), 7.19 (b, 1H), 7.06 (s, 2H),
6.99 (d, J = 8.60 Hz, 1H), 6.93 (d, J = 8.66 Hz, 1H), 3.96 (s, 3H), 3.91
(s, 3H), 3.76 (s, 6H). LRMS m/z (%) 425 (M+1, 100). HRMS ESI (M+H)+
calculated for C22H20N2O7: 425.1349. Found: 425.1351.

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General/Typical Procedure:
1-((3-Chlorophenyl)(phenyl)(4-(pyrrolidin-1-ylmethyl)phenyl)methyl)-1H-imidazole
(10a) To a solution of 9a (320 mg, 0.848 mmol) and a drop of DMF in dry
dichloromethane (15 mL) was added SOCl2 (180 μL, 2.54 mmol) in dry
dichloromethane (10 mL) at 0 °C, and the mixture was stirred at 0 °C for
20 min and thereafter heated at 45 °C for 4h. The volatiles were removed
and the residue was treated with dry acetonitrile (3 × 10 mL) and
concentrated under reduced pressure in order to remove residual SOCl2.
The resulting hydrochloride salt (360 mg, 0.847 mmol) was suspended in 20
mL of dry acetonitrile and to this was added slowly a solution containing
triethyl amine (580 μL, 4.16 mmol) and imidazole (280 mg, 4.16 mmol) in
acetonitrile (10 mL) at 0 °C. Thereafter, the reaction mixture was heated
at 80 °C for 4h. The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure and
the residue was treated with water and extracted with ethyl acetate (2 ×
30 mL). The combined organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated
in vacuo. The crude residue was purified by flash column chromatography
(2% methanol in chloroform) to afford 10a as a brown oil.
1-((4-Chlorophenyl)(phenyl)(4-(pyrrolidin-1-ylmethyl)phenyl)methyl)-1H-imidazole
(10b)
(±)-4-(4-((4-Chlorophenyl)(4-fluorophenyl)(1H-imidazol-1-yl)methyl)benzyl)morpholine
(10y) Starting from 9q (0.28 g, 0.67 mmol), the title compound was
prepared following the above described procedure and was obtained as a
light yellow oil (0.29 g, 92%). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.35 (s, 1H),
7.26-7.21 (m, 4H), 7.03- 6.93 (m, 9H), 6.72 (s, 1H), 3.61 (m, 4H), 3.43
(s, 2H), 2.37 (m, 4H); ESI MS m/z (M-imidazole)+ 394.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Angelis, Meri; Fattorusso, Ernesto

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.2 Synthesis of 4 General procedure for the
preparation of 4: A mixture of thioether 3 and imidazole or benzimidazole
(8 equiv.) in degassed glacial AcOH was stirred at 80 °C for 6 h. The
reaction mixture was quenched with an excess saturated NaHCO3 solution
and extracted with CH2Cl2 (15 mL × 3). The combined organic extracts were
washed with brine and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and
evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by
flash column chromatography to afford the corresponding (S, Rp)-4.
1-{(S)-1-[(R)-2-(Cyclohexylthio)ferrocenyl]ethyl}- imidazole (4f). 3f (1
g, 2.69 mmol) and imidazole (1.46 g, 21.52 mmol) in glacial AcOH (10 mL)
were used with reference to the general procedure. Yield: 92%, orange
solid. Rf = 0.3 (EtOAc/hexane/Et3N = 1/1/0.01). [α]D20 +95.6° (c 1.0,
CH2Cl2); m.p.= 153-155 °C; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.40 (s, 1H), 6.91
(s, 1H), 6.75 (s, 1H), 5.57 (q, 1H, J = 7.0 Hz), 4.47 (s, 1H), 4.39 (s,
1H), 4.30 (s, 1H), 4.16 (s, 5H), 1.80 (d, 3H, J = 7.0 Hz), 1.55-1.32 (m,
6H), 1.03-0.80 (m, 5H); 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 135.6, 128.7, 116.8,
90.1, 77.7, 76.9, 70.3, 68.2, 67.3, 50.9, 47.6, 33.7, 32.6, 25.9, 25.5,
22.3; IR (cm-1) 3066, 2977, 2924, 2849, 1653, 1492, 1449, 1400, 1338,
1249, 1216, 1107, 1069, 1033, 999, 906, 817, 734, 662; MS(EI): 394.13
[M]+; HRMS(EI): calcd for C21H26FeN2S [M]+: 394.1166; found 394.1181.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Protection Procedure: To a solution of
1a (142 mg, 1 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) were added at r.t. imidazole (340 mg, 5
mmol) and TBDMSCl (226 mg, 1.5 mmol). The resulting mixture was stirred
overnight for 1 d, diluted with ether, washed with water, and the organic
layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure.
Purification of the residue by column chromatography afforded 2a. 2e,
yield 91%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Alkylation of
N-Heterocycles (1, 3, 5, and 7) in Acetone, Acetonitrile, or
Dimethylformamide Solution at 26 °C To a solution of 1.80 mmol of the
heterocyclic compound and 2.16 mmol of anhydrous alkali carbonate in
10-30 ml of dry acetone, acetonitrile or dimethylformamide was added 1.98
mmol of the alkylating agent, and in certain cases also 58 mg (0.18 mmol)
of TBAB. The reaction mixture was stirred at 26 °C for the appropriate
time shown in the tables. After that, the inorganic salts were filtered
off, and the filtrate was concentrated. Then the residue was taken up in
DCM or, if it had contained a PTC, in diethyl ether or ethyl acetate, and
the mixture was washed with water twice. Finally the organic phase was
dried (MgSO4), filtered, and concentrated to afford the alkylated
heterocycles (2, 4, 6, and 8). Imidazole-1-acetic Acid Ethyl Ester (4a)
Yield 91%, oil. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 200 MHz) δ 7.49 (s, 1H), 7.07 (t, J = 1.1,
1H), 6.95 (t, J = 1.5, 1H), 4.70 (s, 2H), 4.23 (q, J = 7.1, 2H), 1.28 (t,
J = 7.1, 3H) [lit.[13] 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.42 (s, 1H), 6.92 (s, 1H), 6.82
(s, 1H), 4.68 (s, 2H), 4.12 (q, 2H), 1.23 (t, 3H)]; 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ
167.2 (COO-), 137.7 (CH=), 129.3 (CH=), 119.8 (CH=), 61.8 (CH2), 47.7
(CH2), 13.8 (CH3); IR (film) 3385, 1749, 1510, 1217, 759 cm-1.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM alternative reaction conditions shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 534-17-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 66-71-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 123-91-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Experimental Procedures C for the Cu(I)-catalyzed One-pot
Synthesis of 2-Imidazylbenzimidazoles 6 Using o-Haloarylcarbodiimides
(Table 2). An oven-dried Schlenk tube was charged with a magnetic stir
bar, imidazole or 2-methylimidazole 5 (0.6 mmol, 1.2 equiv.), CuI (10 mg,
0.05 mmol, 10 mol%), 1,10-Phen·H2O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol, 20 mol%), and Cs2CO3
(326 mg, 1.0 mmol, 2.0 equiv.). The Schlenk tube was capped with a Teflon
screwcap, and then evacuated and backfilled with N2 (this sequence was
carried out three times). Under a positive pressure of N2, dioxane (1.5
mL) was added via syringe and the mixture was pre-stirred at 60 °C in a
preheated oil bath for 10 min. Then a solution of o-haloarylcarbodiimide
1 (0.5 mmol, 1.0 equiv.) in dioxane (1.5 mL) was added dropwise via
syringe (for about 30 min). The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir at the indicated temperature for 24-36 h. The reaction
was stopped and cooled to room temperature. The reaction mixture was
directly passed through celite and rinsed with an additional 30 mL of
AcOEt. The combined filtrate was concentrated by rotatory evaporation,
and the residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel using
petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (1:1 v/v) as eluent to give the
corresponding product 6. The product could be further purified by
recrystallization from warm Et2O.
2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)-6-methyl-1-phenyl-1H-benzo[d]imidazole (6a) m.p.
136-138 °C; IR (neat) v 3060, 2917, 1619, 1592, 1547, 1488, 1432, 1306,
1058, 1014, 817, 706 cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.74 (s, 1H), 7.66
(d, J = 8.8 Hz, 1H), 7.50-7.56 (m, 3H), 7.28-7.30 (m, 2H), 7.17 (d, J =
8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.10 (s, 1H), 7.03 (s, 1H), 6.97 (s, 1H), 2.42 (s, 3H) ppm;
13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 141.8, 138.0, 135.6, 134.0, 133.7, 131.5,
130.0, 129.2, 128.0, 126.4, 124.7, 118.8, 109.8, 21.3 ppm; Anal. Calcd.
for C17H14N4: C 74.43, H 5.14, N 20.42, found: C 74.36, H 5.08, N 20.57;
EI-MS: m/z = 274 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM anhydrous condition required, sealed tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-Catalyzed Cascade Addition/Cyclization: An Efficient and Versatile
Synthesis of N-Substituted 2-Heterobenzimidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Lv, Xin; Bao, Weiliang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(15), 5618-5621

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the tandem reaction of
(2-(alkynyl)benzylidene)malonate 1 with imidazole 2. Imidazole 2 (0.2
mmol) was added to a solution of 2-(2-(alkyny)benylidene)malonate 1 (0.24
mmol) and t-BuOK (0.2 mmol) in CH3CN (2.0 mL), and the mixture was
stirred at room temperature. After completion of reaction as indicated by
TLC, the mixture was quenched with saturated aqueous NH4Cl, extracted
with EtOAc, and dried by anhydrous Na2SO4. Evaporation of the solvent
followed by purification on silica gel provided the product 3.
(Z)-Dimethyl
1-benzylidene-3-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1H-indene-2,2(3H)-dicarboxylate
3{1,1}: yellow oil. (Z)-Dimethyl
3-benzylidene-5-fluoro-1-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1H-indene-2,2(3H)-dicarboxylate
3{3,1}: yellow oil. Yield 91%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 2.87 (s, 3H),
3.72 (s, 3H), 6.52 (s, 1H), 6.61 (s, 1H), 6.91 (s, 1H), 7.00-7.10 (m,
1H), 7.23-7.38 (m, 7H), 7.43 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H); 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 52.4, 53.6, 66.2, 70.1, 107.6 (d, 2JCF= 23.7 Hz), 117.3 (d,
2JCF= 23.6 Hz), 119.1, 127.3 (d, 3JCF= 9.16 Hz), 128.2, 128.8, 128.9,
132.7, 134.4 (d, 4JCF= 3.0 Hz), 135.3, 137.3, 144.5 (d, 3JCF= 9.16 Hz),
164.4 (d, 1JCF= 248 Hz), 166.6, 168.4; HRMS calcd for C23H20FN2O4 (M++H):
407.1407; Found: 407.1396.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 123-91-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Catalytic Reactions. A
solution of ligand (14.6 mg, 0.03 mmol), [(η 3-allyl)PdCl]2 (5.5 mg,
0.015 mmol), cinnamyl alcohol (1.0 mmol), and amine (1.5 mmol) in dioxane
(0.2 mL) was stirred under argon atmosphere at 80 °C for 2.5-8.0 h
(depending on substrate). The reaction mixture was then cooled to rt,
diluted with DCM (5 mL), and filtered through a pad of Na2SO4. The
filtrate was evaporated under reduced pressure, and the residue was
purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel (230-400 mesh)
using ethyl acetate/petroleum ether or methanol/dichloromethane as a
eluent. N-(3-p-Tolylallyl)imidazole (5e). Solid. 1H NMR(300 MHz,CDCl3): δ
7.72 (d, J = 6.6 Hz, 1H), 7.28 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.15 (d, J = 8.3Hz,
3H), 6.99 (s, 1H), 6.54 (d, J = 15.8 Hz, 1H), 6.24 (td, J = 15.8, 6.0 Hz,
1H), 4.74 (d, J = 6.0 Hz, 2H), 2.35 (s, 3H). 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ
138.4, 137.0, 134.1, 133.0, 129.5, 128.9, 126.6, 122.3, 119.2, 49.4,
21.3. HRMS (ESI): calcd for C13H15N2 ([M + H]+) 199.1235, found 199.1230.
Mp: 60.0 °C.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Palladium-catalyzed amination of allyl alcohols
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ghosh, Raju; Sarkar, Amitabha

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of Compound (Z)-5. A solution of imidazole 2a (62.6 mg, 0.92
mmol) in DMF (1 mL) was added dropwise to a mixture of (E)-3ab (200.6 mg,
0.92 mmol) and K3PO4 (381.6 mg, 1.8 mmol) in DMF (1 mL) via syringe. The
mixture was heated to 80 °C and stirred for 12 h (monitored by TLC). The
reaction mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature and quenched
with H2O (20 mL). The aqueous phase was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 x 10
mL). The organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and filtered, and the
filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The crude product was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel using a hexane/dichloromethane (5:1)
mixture as eluent to afford (Z)-5.
(Z)-1-(1-(1H-Imidazo1-yl)-2-(4-methoxyphenyl)vinyl)-1H-pyrazole ((Z)-5):
yield 85% (226.1 mg), white solid. mp 86.6-87.6 °C; 1H NMR (400 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 7.58 (s, 1H), 7.49 (s, 1H), 7.18 (s, 1H), 7.06 (s, 1H), 6.90 (s,
2H), 6.70 (s, 4H), 6.54 (s, 1H), 3.70 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ
160.0, 137.4, 135.8, 131.2, 130.7, 129.8, 125.1, 123.7, 118.7, 117.5,
116.4, 114.5, 55.3; HRMS (EI) calcd for C15H14N4O [M]+ 266.1168, found
266.1169. Crystal data for (E)-5: C15H14N4O, M = 266.30, Monoclinic,
space group P2(1), a = 7.3446(11), b = 10.3043(16), c = 9.2757(14) Å, ɑ
=90 deg, β =101.418(3) deg, γ = 90 deg, V = 688.10(18)Å3, Z = 2, Dc =
1.285 g/cm3, μ = 0.085 mm-1, F(000) = 280, crystal size: 0.211 x 0.158 x
0.123 mm3, θ range 2.24~25.99 deg, R indices (all data) R1 = 0.0802, wR2
= 0.3089.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of Diimidazole 7. To a flask were added 6 (96 mg, 0.2 mmol),
and redisted CH3CN (8 mL). After the mixture was refluxed under stirring
for 5 h, it was cooled to room temperature, washed with water, and
extracted with dichloromethane (3x15 mL). The combined organic layers
were desiccated with anhydrous sodium sulfate, filtered, and evaporated
to dryness under vacuum. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to give. Yellow powder, yield (100 mg, 91%). Mp
204.3−205.7 °C; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm) 7.58 (s, 2H), 7.45 (s,
2H), 7.23 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 4H), 7.09 (s, 2H), 6.92 (s, 2H), 6.91 (d, J =
8.6 Hz, 4H), 6.78 (s, 4H), 5.13 (s, 4H), 3.87 (s, 6H); 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3) δ (ppm) 160.2, 147.4, 140.0, 139.5, 137.4, 135.0, 132.0, 131.9,
129.8, 125.8, 125.0, 119.3, 118.2, 114.1, 55.3, 50.9; FTIR (KBr) ν 3439,
2929, 1601, 1571, 1506, 1443, 1416, 1389, 1291, 1248, 1175, 1108, 1075,
1028, 906, 820, 737, 663, 630, 598 cm−1; ESI+ HRMS m/z calcd for
C36H31N4O2 551.2447 [M+H]+, found 551.2422.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 288-32-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 18162-48-6
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36219-80-4
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 410097-80-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-614-CAS-28392279
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Protection Procedure: To a solution of
1a (142 mg, 1 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) were added at r.t. imidazole (340 mg, 5
mmol) and TBDMSCl (226 mg, 1.5 mmol). The resulting mixture was stirred
overnight for 1 d, diluted with ether, washed with water, and the organic
layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure.
Purification of the residue by column chromatography afforded 2a. 2d,
yield 91%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A convenient protecting group for aldehydes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Quan, Long Guo; Cha, Jin Kun
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2001), (12), 1925-1926

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME268 STEP1
$RXN



  2  1
$MOL
Imidazole

$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Trimethylsilyl 1H-imidazole-1-carboxylate (II). A mixture of 15 g of
imidazole and 41.66 g of trimethylsilyl diethylcarbamate was heated at a
complete reflux to complete release of diethylamine. By fractionation
compound was isolated II. Trimethylsilyl 1H-imidazole-1-carboxylate (II),
36.88 g (91%) bp 100–101°C (2 mm Hg), n20 1.4463. IR spectrum, ν, cm–1:
3080 (C=CH), 1660 (C=O), 1520 (C=N). 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm: 0.37 s (9H,
SiCH3), 6.95 s (2H, NCH), 7.6 s (1H, NCHN). Found, %: C 45.32; H 6.37; N
15.34. C7H12N2O2Si. Calculated, %: C 45.63; H 6.56; N 15.20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM heating until complete release of Et2NH
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Unusual course of diazolees silylation and N-siloxycarbonylation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kirilin, A. D.; Belova, L. O.; Pletneva, M. V.; Panfilova, V. M.;
Storozhenko, P. A.; Sheludyakov, V. D.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Russian Journal of General Chemistry (2011), 81(7), 1493-1495

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-85-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 12.
2-[(E)-2-(2-Fluoro-4-tritluoromethyl-phenyl)-vinyl]-4-[4-(4-imidazol-1-ylmethyl-thiazol-2-yl)-phenoxymethyl]-oxazole.
A suspension of 2.40 g (10 mmol)
4-chloromethyl-2-(4-methoxy-phenyl)-thiazole, 1.02 g (15 mmol) imidazole,
0.17 g (1 mmol) potassium iodide and 0.60 g (15 mmol) sodium hydroxide in
25 ml 2-methyl-2-butanol was stirred at 120°C for 5 h. After evaporation,
the residue was quenched with water and extracted with ethyl acetate. The
extract was dried and concentrated to yield 2.47 g (91%)
1-[2-(4-methoxy-phenyl)-thiazol-4-ylmethyl]-imidazole as beige crystals.
melting at 89-90°C. MS: M = 272.2(API+). 1H-NMR(400MHz, D6-DMSO): δ=
3.82(s, 3H, OCH3), 5.32(s, 2H, CH 2), 6.92(5, 1H, imidazole), 7.05(d, 2H,
Ar-H), 7.25(s, 1H, imidazole), 7.42(5, 1H, imidazole), 7.77(5, 1H,
thiazole), 7.86(d, 2H, Ar-H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of (E)-2-phenylethenyl-4-(arylalkoxy)-oxazoles or -thiazoles
as HER-2 tyrosine kinases inhibitors and their use in the treatment of
cancer
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Bossenmaier, Birgit; Friebe, Walter-Gunar; Reiff, Ulrike; Rueth,
Matthias; Voss, Edgar
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2005040158 A1 2005-05-06

$DATUM 1.8 2-(3S-3-methylmorpholino)-4-(imidazo1-yl)-6-methy5-nitropyrimidine
(1) The chloropyrimidine 9 prepared above (40.04 g, 147.2 mmol, 1.0
equiv) was dissolved in 300 mL anhydrous EtOH followed by the addition of
30.07 g imidazole (441.6 mmol, 3.0 equiv) under N2. The flask was
equipped with a condenser and placed in a preheated 80 °C bath with
magnetic stirring. After stirring for 75 min the solution was cooled to
it and concentrated under reduced pressure. Purification via flash
chromatography (SiO2 , 2-4% MeOH/CH2Cl2) gave the product as a yellow
oil. Upon standing the oil crystallized to give a yellow solid which was
titurated with hexanes, filtered, and washed (3 x hexanes) to give of the
product. Yellow crystals, yield (40.53 g, 133.3 mmol, 91%). mp = 74-75
°C; [α]25 D = +152.6° (c = 1.03, MeOH); IR (KBr) 3116, 2972, 2855, 1586,
1482, 1443, 1329, 1315, 1239, 1205, 1129, 1074, 1007, 897, 844, 773, 739,
650 cm-1; 1H NMR (CDCl3, 400 MHz) δ 8.10 (s, 1 H), 7.21 (m, 1 H), 7.17
(m, 1 H), 4.80 (m, 1 H), 4.48 (m, 1 H), 4.02 (dd, J = 3.7, 11.7 Hz, 1 H),
3.80 (d, J = 11.7 Hz, 1 H), 3.68 (dd, J = 3.3, 11.7 Hz, 1 H), 3.52 (ddd,
J = 2.9, 11.7, 12.1 Hz, 1 H), 3.36 (ddd, J = 3.7, 12.9, 13.5 Hz, 1 H),
2.53 (s, 3 H), 1.38 (d, J = 7.0 Hz, 3 H); ESI-MS m/z 305.1 (100, M+H+).
Anal. Found for C13H16N6O3: C, 51.31; H, 5.30; N, 27.62. Found: C, 51.47;
H, 5.30; N, 27.79.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. A flame-dried Schlenk test
tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI (38.4 mg, 0.2
mmol), K3PO4 (0.422 g, 2.0 mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.4
mmol), aryl halide (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under N2 atmosphere. A
rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the system was then
evacuated twice and back filled with N2. After being stirred at 35-40 °C
for 40 h, the reaction mixture was diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 4-Imidazol-1-yl-benzoic acid ethyl ester (3m)4-6 Following the
general procedure, the crude product was purified over a silica gel
column using ethyl acetate/petroleum ether (1/1) to give a white solid
(91% yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 1.36 (t, J= 7.6 Hz, 3H), 4.36 (m,
2H), 7.25 (bs, 1H), 7.36 (bs, 1H), 7.45-7.47 (m, 2H), 7.96 (bs, 1H),
8.11-8.16 (m, 2H) ppm. 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ 14.3, 61.3, 117.9,
120.1, 120.5, 129.4, 131.1, 131.5, 140.6, 165.5 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 216
[M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Functional Group Tolerance in Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of
Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles under Mild Conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(5), 2200-2202

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
4-Imidazol-1-yl-benzoic acid ethyl ester (6e)3 Following the general
procedure, imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with ethyl
4-bromobenzoate (122 µL, 0.75 mmol) for 60 h at 90 ºC. The crude product
was purified over a silica gel column using ethyl acetate/petrol ether
(1/1) to give a white solid (91% yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 1.36
(t, J = 7.6 Hz, 3H), 4.36 (m, 2H), 7.25 (bs, 1H), 7.36 (bs, 1H),
7.45-7.47 (m, 2H), 7.96 (bs, 1H), 8.11-8.16 (m, 2H) ppm. 13C NMR (75 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 14.3, 61.3, 117.9, 120.1, 120.5, 129.4, 131.1, 131.5, 140.6,
165.5 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 216 [M+]
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst (polymer-supported ionic liq.-copper complex)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(45), 13879-13886

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Dimethyl
2-(imidazole-1-yl)-3-(triphenylphosphoranylidene)butanedioate (3a)
General Procedure To a magnetically stirred solution of
triphenylphosphine (0.26 g or 1 mmol) and imidazole (0.68 g or 1 mmol) in
10 mL of dry ethyl acetate; a mixture of dimethyl acetylenedicarboxylate
(0.12 mL or 1 mmol) was added dropwise in 4 mL of dry ethyl acetate at
-5°C for 10 min. after approximately 24 h of stirring at r. t. the
product was filtered and recrystallized from ethyl acetate. Diethyl
2-(imidazole-1-yl)-3-(triphenylphosphoranylidene)butanedioate (3b)
Colorless crystals, yield 0.46 g, 91%. m.p. 185-187°C; IR (KBr) (νmax,
cm-1): 1731 and 1623 (C=O). MS (m/z, %): 455(M-OCH2CH3, 6), 433 (M-Ph,
5), 262 (PPh3, 80), 183 (PPh2, 57), 108 (PPh, 41), 77 (Ph, 37), 73
(CO2Et, 2), 67 (heterocycle, 14).

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-Oligo(ethylene glycol) Monomethyl Ether
Imidazoles (2a-c). General Procedure. To a stirring solution of imidazole
(10.00 g, 147.0 mmol) in freshly distilled THF (300 mL) was added NaH (60
wt % in mineral oil; 7.35 g, 184 mmol). Hydrogen gas was observed to
bubble from the reaction mixture. The cloudy white solution was stirred
at 50 °C for 1 h. A tosylate (1a-c; 147 mmol) was added, and the solution
was heated to reflux. After 3 h, the brown solution was cooled to ambient
temperature and filtered. The THF solvent was evaporated, and the
resulting brown oil was dissolved in MeOH (100 mL) and washed with
hexanes (100 mL). Evaporation of the solvent gave a crude brown oil,
which was purified by filtration through a short column of silica gel
with 20:1 CH2Cl2/MeOH. The pure product as a clear light brown oil.
Typical yields were near 90%.
1-(2-(2-(2-Methoxyethoxy)ethoxy)ethyl)-imidazole 2c. Yield = 25.01 g,
91%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 3.37 (s, 3H), 3.54 (m, 2H), 3.60 (m, 6H),
3.75 (t, 2H), 4.12 (t, 2H), 7.00 (d, 1H), 7.04 (d, 1H), 7.56 (s, 1H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Enhanced CO2 Separation Selectivity in Oligo(ethylene glycol)
Functionalized Room-Temperature Ionic Liquids
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Bara, Jason E.; Gabriel, Christopher J.; Lessmann, Sonja; Carlisle,
Trevor K.; Finotello, Alexia; Gin, Douglas L.; Noble, Richard D.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Industrial & Engineering Chemistry Research (2007), 46(16), 5380-5386

$DATUM 7693-26-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM N-iPr-imidazole. Acetonitrile was added to a mixture of imidazole (1.36
g, 20 mmol) and potassium hydride (800 mg, 20 mmol) at 0 °C, and the
reaction allowed to warm to RT with stirring for approximately 2 h (until
visible gas evolution stopped). The sample was then cooled to 0 °C, and
isopropyl iodide (2.99 mL, 5.1 g, 30 mmol) added. The reaction mixture
was stirred overnight at RT (further manipulations were carried out in an
open laboratory), acetonitrile removed in vacuo, and the product
extracted with dichloromethane to give a yellowish oil (2 g, 91%).
N-iPr-imidazole, yield (2 g, 91%).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis, Structures, and Reactivity of Chelating
Bis-N-Heterocyclic-Carbene Complexes of Iron(II)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zlatogorsky, Sergey; Muryn, Christopher A.; Tuna, Floriana; Evans, David
J.; Ingleson, Michael J.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organometallics (2011), 30(18), 4974-4982
